summary: Tournament Khelba - A Free Fire tournament management platform sponsored by Code 11, featuring user registration, tournament listings (Solo/Duo/Squad), manual wallet system, custom room management, leaderboards, and admin panel for esports tournaments in Bangladesh
architectural_notes: Backend built with Motoko on Internet Computer
Frontend using React + TypeScript with Tailwind CSS
Authentication via Internet Identity (passkeys + social logins)
No real-time features - in-app updates only when users refresh
No direct payment gateway integration - manual tracking by admins
Manual Free Fire UID entry (no automatic verification from game servers)
Admin-uploaded match results and leaderboard management
Player profile creation is optional after authentication - users can browse without completing profile
Profile completion (Free Fire UID + player name) is mandatory before tournament registration
Squad/team system stores persistent teams with member management and squad-based registrations
known_issues: Cannot integrate with bKash/Nagad/Rocket payment gateways - requires manual payment tracking
No real-time push notifications or live chat capabilities
Cannot verify Free Fire UIDs automatically or pull data from game servers
Match results must be manually uploaded by admins or players

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication system using Internet Identity that allows players to sign up and sign in with passkeys and social logins
Create player profile system that stores and displays Free Fire UID (manually entered), player statistics including total tournaments played, wins, kills, and tournament history

Build tournament dashboard that lists all upcoming tournaments with filters for Solo, Duo, and Squad game modes, displaying entry fee, prize pool, start date and time, available slots remaining, and current registration status
Implement tournament registration system that allows players to join tournaments, deducts entry fee from their wallet balance, and displays custom room ID and password before match start time

Create manual wallet system that tracks player balance, displays transaction history for deposits and withdrawals, and shows pending/completed status for each transaction (admin-managed outside the app)

Build results tracking and leaderboard system that displays tournament results after admin uploads match data, showing player rankings, kills, and prize distribution for each tournament, plus global leaderboards for daily, weekly, and monthly performance

Create comprehensive admin panel that allows admins to create and edit tournaments with all details (mode, entry fee, prize pool, slots, date/time, room credentials), manage user accounts and verify Free Fire UIDs, approve or reject wallet deposit and withdrawal requests, manually credit winnings to player wallets after tournament completion, and view all transactions and user activities

Integrate Code 11 sponsor branding throughout the platform including 'Presented by Code 11' text on splash screen, home page, and tournament pages, Code 11 logo placement in header or footer, and sponsor banner on key pages

Design and implement a dark gaming theme with neon highlights and vibrant esports-focused visual style, using energetic colors like neon green, cyan, magenta, and orange against dark backgrounds, with bold typography and gaming-inspired UI elements that create an immersive tournament atmosphere
Remove the ProfileSetupModal from appearing automatically after authentication so that players can skip profile creation and browse tournaments freely
Implement frontend enforcement that shows the ProfileSetupModal when a user without a complete profile attempts to register for a tournament, blocking the registration until profile is completed
Update the profile query hooks to fetch and cache profile completeness status so tournament registration flows can check it efficiently

Create a notifications center page accessible from the Header that displays tournament-related updates including 'Tournament starting in 30 minutes', 'Results are now available', 'New tournament created', and 'Registration confirmed' notifications with timestamp, read/unread status, and notification type icons, updating when users refresh the page

Build a player statistics dashboard page that displays comprehensive performance metrics including total tournaments played, win rate percentage, average kills per match, total earnings, and favorite game mode with visual charts using a charting library, replacing the current mock-based ProfilePage statistics section

Add tournament search and filtering functionality to the TournamentDashboard that allows users to search tournaments by name or description, filter by prize pool range using min/max inputs, filter by date range using date pickers, and filter by entry fee brackets with preset options like 'Free', '0-50 BDT', '50-100 BDT', '100+ BDT', with all filters working together

Implement a squad/team management system that allows players to create persistent squads with a team name and tag, invite members by entering their player name or Free Fire UID, accept or decline squad invitations, view squad member list with roles (captain/member), track squad performance metrics including total tournaments played together and squad win rate, and register as a complete squad for Squad-mode tournaments

Create a player ranking system with tier badges (Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, Master, Grandmaster) calculated based on tournament performance metrics including total wins, win rate, average kills, and total tournaments played, display the tier badge on player profiles and leaderboards, and show rank progression bar indicating progress toward the next tier

Add a tournament comments section on the TournamentDetailPage where registered participants can post comments and questions, view all comments with author name and timestamp sorted by newest first, and see comment updates when refreshing the page, with backend storage per tournament

Create a Featured Tournaments section on the TournamentDashboard that displays premium tournaments with higher prize pools and special styling including a 'Featured' badge, golden highlight border, and Code 11 or partner sponsor logo, with admin ability to mark tournaments as featured in the admin panel

Add a Practice Mode section on the TournamentDashboard listing zero entry fee practice matches where players can test their skills, with practice matches having similar details as regular tournaments but clearly marked as 'Practice Mode' with no entry fee and no prize pool, allowing players to register without wallet deduction

Implement a referral system where each player receives a unique referral code, can share it with friends, earns 50 BDT bonus wallet credits when a referred friend completes their first tournament, and can view referral statistics including total referrals and total earnings from referrals on a referral dashboard page

Add bulk tournament creation functionality to the admin TournamentManagementPanel that allows admins to create multiple tournaments at once by specifying base tournament details and a recurrence pattern (daily, weekly) with number of occurrences, automatically generating tournaments with incremented dates and sequential naming

Create a player verification system with multiple verification levels (Unverified, UID Verified, Payment Verified, Fully Verified) displayed as badges on player profiles and leaderboards, with admin panel controls to verify Free Fire UID and payment history, and display verification level in tournament participant lists

Add tournament template functionality to the admin TournamentManagementPanel allowing admins to save current tournament configurations as reusable templates with a template name, load saved templates to pre-fill tournament creation form, edit existing templates, delete templates, and display a list of available templates with template details
Update the useQueries.ts useAdminCheck hook to call the backend isAdmin function instead of returning mock data
Update AdminDashboard.tsx to completely block access and redirect non-admin users to the tournament dashboard with an error toast message stating 'Access denied: Admin privileges required'
Update Header.tsx to hide the Admin link in navigation for non-admin users so only admins can see the admin menu option
Create an AdminSetup component that displays the user's principal ID with a copy-to-clipboard button and a form to add the first admin principal ID, shown only when the admin list is empty

Add an Admin Management section to the AdminDashboard that allows existing admins to view the list of current admin principals, add new admins by entering their principal ID, and remove admins with confirmation dialog

Implement skeleton loading screens across all major pages (TournamentDashboard, TournamentDetailPage, LeaderboardPage, ProfilePage, WalletPage, NotificationsPage, StatisticsDashboard, SquadsPage, ReferralDashboard, AdminDashboard) that display content structure placeholders while data is being fetched, replacing generic spinners with page-specific skeleton layouts that mirror the actual content structure

Create helpful and specific error messages throughout the application that clearly explain what went wrong and provide actionable next steps, replacing generic error alerts with context-aware messages for common failure scenarios including network errors, authentication failures, validation errors, and backend operation failures

Design empty state screens for all list and collection views including tournament lists when no tournaments exist, notifications center when no notifications exist, wallet transaction list when no transactions exist, squad member lists when no members exist, and leaderboards when no data exists, each with relevant illustrations or icons, helpful text explaining the empty state, and clear call-to-action buttons to populate the section

Add success animations and visual feedback for key user actions including tournament registration confirmation, profile update success, wallet transaction submission, squad creation, comment posting, and admin operations, using smooth fade-in animations, checkmark icons, and celebratory micro-interactions that provide clear confirmation without being intrusive

Enhance mobile responsiveness across all pages by improving touch targets to minimum 44px, optimizing layouts for small screens with single-column stacking, ensuring readable font sizes without zooming, making navigation menus mobile-friendly with hamburger menu or bottom nav, ensuring all modals and forms are usable on phone screens, and testing all interactive elements for touch usability

Redesign TournamentCard component to show visual information at a glance by adding game mode icons (Solo/Duo/Squad), highlighting prize pool with larger typography and neon glow effects, displaying slot availability with progress bars or visual indicators, showing entry fee prominently with currency formatting, and adding status badges for tournament state with color-coded visual hierarchy

Streamline tournament registration flow by reducing the registration process to fewer clicks, pre-filling user information where available, showing registration confirmation immediately without page reload, displaying room ID and password in a prominent modal with copy-to-clipboard functionality, and providing clear feedback at each step of the registration process

Add clear visual status indicators to tournament cards and detail pages showing Open status with green accent when registration is available, Full status with orange accent when all slots are filled, Started status with cyan accent when tournament is in progress, and Completed status with gray accent when tournament has ended, using color-coded badges, icons, and text labels that are immediately recognizable

Improve visibility of remaining slots and registration deadlines on tournament cards and TournamentDetailPage by displaying remaining slots with fraction format (e.g., '8/20 slots remaining') and visual progress bar, showing registration deadline with countdown timer (e.g., 'Registration closes in 2 hours'), and highlighting urgent information when slots are low or deadline is near with warning colors

Reorganize the Header navigation menu for better information architecture by grouping related features together, prioritizing frequently accessed pages like Tournaments, My Profile, and Wallet in primary navigation, moving secondary features like Squads, Referrals, and Statistics to a sub-menu or user dropdown, and ensuring navigation labels are clear and descriptive

Enhance search and filter UX on TournamentDashboard by making the TournamentFilters component more intuitive with larger touch targets for filter options, adding real-time result count updates as filters are applied, providing clear visual feedback when filters are active, adding a 'Clear All Filters' button for easy reset, and improving the layout for better mobile usability

Add shortcuts and quick access features to frequently used sections by creating a 'Quick Actions' floating action button or menu that provides one-click access to My Tournaments, Register for Tournament, Check Wallet Balance, and View Notifications, positioned strategically for easy thumb reach on mobile devices

Streamline wallet transaction flow on WalletPage by redesigning deposit and withdrawal cards with simplified forms requiring fewer fields, adding visual feedback for pending transactions, improving transaction history display with better categorization and filtering options, and making transaction details easier to understand with clear labels and formatting

Implement smooth page transitions throughout the application using fade-in animations when navigating between routes, smooth slide-in animations for modals and side panels, gentle fade animations for content appearing after loading, and ensuring all transitions are hardware-accelerated for 60fps performance

Improve contrast and readability across all UI components by ensuring text meets WCAG AA contrast standards (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text) against dark backgrounds, increasing font sizes for critical information like prize pools and tournament titles, adjusting neon colors where they compromise readability, and ensuring all interactive elements have sufficient visual weight

Apply consistent spacing and alignment across all pages and components by establishing a unified spacing system using multiples of 4px (4, 8, 16, 24, 32px), ensuring consistent padding and margins for cards and containers, aligning form elements consistently, standardizing gap spacing in grid and flex layouts, and maintaining consistent component sizing throughout the application

Create engaging button states with clear visual feedback by implementing hover effects with neon glow intensification, active/pressed states with subtle scale transform, disabled states with reduced opacity and grayscale filter, loading states with spinner animations, and ensuring all state transitions are smooth with 150-200ms duration

Build a new enhanced sponsor visibility system completely separate from existing Code 11 branding that displays animated sponsor banners on all major pages including TournamentDashboard, TournamentDetailPage, AdminDashboard, LeaderboardPage, ProfilePage, WalletPage, NotificationsPage, StatisticsDashboard, SquadsPage, and ReferralDashboard, featuring eye-catching animations like slide-in, fade pulse, or subtle scale effects, prominent placement in header or hero sections, and clear sponsor logo and text that makes Code 11 sponsorship highly visible and engaging
